synthesis of benzoxazines under room temperature conditions without
sacrificing good reaction yields using a model benzoxazine based on
bisphenol A, hexylamine, and formaldehyde ( BA-hex MRA Systems LLC NA NA Singapore Technologies Engineering Ltd NA NA pmc-status-qastatus 0 pmc-status-live yes pmc-status-embargo no pmc-status-released yes pmc-prop-open-access yes pmc-prop-olf no pmc-prop-manuscript no pmc-prop-legally-suppressed no pmc-prop-has-pdf yes pmc-prop-has-supplement yes pmc-prop-pdf-only no pmc-prop-suppress-copyright no pmc-prop-is-real-version no pmc-prop-is-scanned-article no pmc-prop-preprint no pmc-prop-in-epmc yes document-id-old-9 ao5c07831 document-id-new-14 ao5c07831 production-flag-MathML-config-version 3 production-flag-journal-citation-display-style acs-titles production-flag-journal-date-display-style dates-used-rcd-rvd-acc production-flag-si-avail yes document-id-alt-64 146abbf740398296ed7c5ee3042349c37b95e7d0bc88a60580f6d9683cb52595 1 Introduction Polybenzoxazines, produced
through the cationic ring-opening polymerization
of the corresponding benzoxazine monomer (3,4-dihydro-2 H      Benzoxazines are typically synthesized by condensing a phenolic
compound with an aldehyde and a primary amine through the Mannich
condensation reaction. The process generally involves heating the
components together in a solvent or melt, leading to the formation
of intermediates, which ultimately cyclize, producing the oxazine
ring. Understanding the chemical structures and compositions of the
crude products helps to comprehend the reaction pathway involved in
the formation of benzoxazines. Kinetic and mechanistic studies have
been conducted in order to examine the production of the oxazine rings
during the synthesis of benzoxazines using phenol, primary amine,
and formaldehyde as starting materials.     In this work, we carried out a systematic
study focused on identifying
the key crude products to enhance the efficiency of the synthesis
of more conventional benzoxazines at room temperature. To achieve
this goal, it was necessary to demonstrate first the feasibility of
synthesizing a more conventional benzoxazine, based on bisphenol A,
hexylamine, and formaldehyde ( BA-hex 2 Experimental Section 2.1 Materials Bisphenol A (97%), hexylamine
(99%), paraformaldehyde, (95%), all three HPLC grade solvents chloroform,
ethanol, and toluene, magnesium sulfate anhydrous (97%), and sodium
hydroxide (97%) were purchased from Sigma-Aldrich. Dimethyl sulfoxide- d d d 2.2 Instrumentation  1 1 d 3 d –1 mono-BZX-BA BA-hex H 2 N BA-hex meta mono-BZX-BA 1 eq Yield ( % ) = 100 × ∫ CH 2 n H ( OCH 2 N ) ∫ H Ar n H ( mono‐BZX‐BA ) + ∫ CH 2 n H ( OCH 2 N ) + ∫ CH 2 n H ( THT ) 1 2 2 N Ar meta mono-BZX-BA 2 2 H 2 N THT n H 2.3 Synthesis of 6,6′-(Propane-2,2-diyl)­bis­(3-hexyl-3,4-dihydro-2 H BA-hex Three different reaction systems were carried
out to synthesize a benzoxazine by adapting a previously reported
method. 2 4 1 3 J J J 13 2.4 Synthesis of 1,3,5-Trihexylhexahydro-1,3,5-triazine
(Hereinafter Referred to as THT Stoichiometric
amounts of hexylamine (0.20 g, 2 mmol) and paraformaldehyde (0.06
g, 2 mmol) were mixed in chloroform (5 mL) in a 20 mL vial. The mixture
was stirred for 24 h at room temperature. Reaction progress was monitored
by 1 THT 1 13 –1 21 45 3 + m z m z 21 45 3 + m z m z 2.5 Model Reaction of BA/Formaldehyde/Hexylamine
with a Stoichiometry of 1:2:2 In a 25 mL round-bottom flask,
stoichiometric amounts of hexylamine (0.20 g, 2 mmol), paraformaldehyde
(0.06 g, 2 mmol), and chloroform (10 mL) were added. The mixture was
stirred at room temperature for 24 h until a completely transparent
solution was obtained. Then, bisphenol A (0.23 g, 1 mmol) was added
to the solution. The mixture was stirred under refluxing conditions
for 96 h. Samples (0.15 mL) were taken from the reaction system at
different times to monitor the progress of the reaction by means of
NMR spectroscopy. Results are analyzed by NMR spectroscopy and discussed
in Section 3 Results and Discussion 3.1 Establishing New Synthetic Routes for Synthesizing
Benzoxazine Monomers at Low Temperatures The present work
has the objective of developing synthetic routes that consume less
energy than the conventional strategies reported to date. To carry
out this work, BA-hex BA-hex Scheme 1 Synthesis of the BA-hex This reaction, as most classical benzoxazine

in influencing the solvation and stabilization of both the reactants
and the reaction intermediates.  Table  BA-hex. 4 Conclusions The present work has provided
a detailed understanding demonstrating
the feasibility of developing room temperature synthetic strategies
for the synthesis of benzoxazine monomers. To achieve this goal, the
synthesis of a typical benzoxazine monomer, BA-hex BA-hex THT para mono-BZX-BA BA-hex BA-hex Carrying out similar room temperature
reactions showed that the
reaction is affected when different solvents are used. Finally, chloroform
is the best solvent for carrying out the synthesis of BA-hex Supplementary Material The authors graciously acknowledge the financial
